","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmf3q","text":"A complete class I and class II haplotype may be performed, including fine typing of the DQB and DRB regions. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19u3t","text":"Genotyping for single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in selected immune-response genes may also be performed. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lsom","text":"The results of genotype analyses may be used to correlate with disease progression and therapeutic responses (tolerance induction). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b2kn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8h0i","text":"6. Whole blood genomics studies: Ribonucleic acid (RNA) purified from whole blood will be used to examine expression of genes of interest. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mlvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6gf1","text":"7. CLBS03 tracking by stable isotope labeling: The persistence of infused Tregs will be assessed by stable isotope enrichment in Tregs purified from peripheral blood using stable isotope labeling with mass spectrometric analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6081q","text":"During ex vivo expansion, the 2H label from deuterated glucose (2H-glucose) contained in the cell culture medium is incorporated into the deoxyribose moiety in replicating DNA through the de novo purine nucleotide synthesis pathway.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":30,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":64,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8booh","text":"Following infusion of stable isotope-labeled Tregs, peripheral blood will be sampled according to the schedule of events. The total number of Tregs in peripheral blood will be measured at each time point by flow cytometry. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bc4d","text":"Cell pellets of Tregs purified from PBMCs by fluorescence activated cell sorting will be frozen and stored until batched for stable-isotope enrichment analysis. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtaq0","text":"Following isolation and hydrolysis of genomic DNA, the isotopic enrichment of the purine deoxyribonucleosides in Tregs sorted from whole blood will be assessed by gas chromatography/mass spectrometry. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6io06","text":"The change in the 2H enrichment of labeled cells in the total peripheral Treg pool will be assessed at times specified in the Schedule of Study Assessments (Section 4).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":18,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5efdg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72vnd","text":"8. Functional cell based assays on cryopreserved samples: Cryopreserved PBMCs will be studied using in vitro cell culture techniques to study T-cell functionality in treated participants. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48sol","text":"Frozen PBMCs will be thawed and Treg will be isolated by flow-based sorting using CD4, CD25 and CD127 (and in some cases CD45RA and CD45RO) antibodies. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7tcp","text":"Treg will be assayed for their ability to suppress polyclonal T-cell responses using either carboxyfluorescein diacetate succinimidyl ester (CFSE) or 3[H]-thymidine assays. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":150,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blnbh","text":"Cytokines in the culture supernatants will be assessed. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sfdn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f35jt","text":"9. Additional exploratory assays: Additional mechanistic assays may be implemented as guided by the efficacy and safety findings of the study utilizing retained biological samples collected (including DNA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30is7","text":"A schedule of the planned exploratory assays is shown below, in Step 7.6. For lower weight subjects, a modified blood collection schedule will be followed from screening to day 28 to comply with current guidelines for blood collection (see the Central Laboratory Manual).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rom3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e01c4","text":"Schedule of Exploratory Biomarker Assays","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"943b8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ima6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c1ah8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":249,"id":464702,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qf4abixhx.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qf38bixhx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qf39bixhx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qf37bixhx.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5uoud","text":"Study Population","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6aaj","text":"Inclusion Criteria:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abj7j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8legi","text":"Subjects who meet ALL of the following criteria are eligible for this study:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jmj3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4gp3","text":"Male and female subjects between the ages of 8 to less than 18 at the time of screening. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"623ck","text":"Diagnosis of T1DM within 100 days of IP administration (treatment visit) according to ADA criteria41 (see Appendix 17.1). For this study, diagnosis based on A1c alone is not acceptable.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8s84s","text":"Positive for at least one islet cell autoantibody (GAD65; IAA [if obtained prior to 10 days after the onset of insulin therapy]; ICA-512/IA-2, ZnT8). ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duqi2","text":"Peak MMTT-stimulated C-peptide level \u003e 0.2 pmol/mL (at the screening visit).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8rmj","text":"Weight of ≥30 kg at the time of screening. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhtl1","text":"Body mass index (BMI) z-score less than 2.25 at the time of screening (see Appendix 17.3).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88au5","text":"For females of childbearing potential, a negative urine pregnancy test is required at Screening and prior to the blood draw for Treg collection at Visit 2. A negative pregnancy test is also required prior to infusion of the treatment at Visit 3. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l4i8","text":"Females of child bearing potential (i.e., females who have reached puberty or have had their first menstrual bleeding) must: a) be surgically sterile, or b) be willing to practice an acceptable method of birth control for the duration of their participation in the study. Acceptable methods of birth control are: oral contraceptive tablets, hormonal implant device, hormonal patch, intrauterine device, diaphragm and contraceptive cream or foam, condom with spermicide, or abstinence. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"849re","text":"Males must agree to use a reliable and acceptable method of contraception for the duration of their participation in the study. Acceptable methods of contraception are: condom with spermicide, or abstinence. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qd4c","text":"Willing and medically acceptable to postpone live and killed vaccine immunizations for one year and 3 months after Visit 3, respectively. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh1om","text":"Subject signing the study ICF. As the subject will be a minor at the time of consent, the subject must provide written assent with the parent or legally authorized representative signing the ICF.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rc6r","text":"Able to comply with and undergo procedures as required for the study.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2kqch","text":"Exclusion Criteria‡:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":19,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":18,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3f2k3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsj03","text":"Hemoglobin less than 12.0 g/dL at the time of screening. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t3v7","text":"Leukocytes \u003c3,000/μL; neutrophils \u003c1,500/μL; lymphocytes \u003c800/μL; platelets \u003c100,000/μL at the time of screening. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tvh8","text":"Regulatory T-cells present in peripheral blood at \u003c20 cells per µL as determined by flow cytometry at screening.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d52b","text":"Use of non-insulin pharmaceuticals (that may affect glycemic control) 15 days or 5 half-lives prior to screening, whichever is longer.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24oaa","text":"Use of systemic corticosteroids or other immunomodulatory drugs 4 weeks or 5 half-lives before study treatment, whichever is longer.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fufap","text":"Serious (requiring hospitalization or an antibiotics course of duration greater than 10 days) bacterial, viral, or fungal infections, or clinically significant opportunistic infections within 90 days prior to Visit 3.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ujhd","text":"History of malignancy or serious uncontrolled (in the judgement of the investigator) cardiovascular, nervous system, pulmonary, renal, or gastrointestinal disease.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fvap","text":"Have serologic evidence of current or past viral infection: HIV, hepatitis B, hepatitis C, and HTLV 1/2.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjg0p","text":"Positive QuantiFERON® TB test or PPD skin test, history of tuberculosis, or active TB infection.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7o4ef","text":"Active infection with EBV as defined by EBV viral load ≥10,000 copies per mL of whole blood.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qprg","text":"Active infection with CMV as defined by CMV viral load ≥10,000 copies per mL of whole blood.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c73ou","text":"Diagnosis of liver disease as defined by alanine aminotransferase (ALT) \u003e3x the upper limit of age-determined normal (ULN) or total bilirubin \u003e1.5 x ULN.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvhur","text":"Pregnant or breast-feeding females.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u5bc","text":"Vaccination with a live virus 8 weeks prior to Visit 3.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bo24u","text":"Vaccination with a killed virus 3 weeks prior to Visit 3.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6imk9","text":"Subjects who have participated in an investigational drug study within 90 days prior to the screening visit.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebc5o","text":"Subjects previously treated with a Treg based cell therapy.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u691","text":"Known history of allergy to gentamicin.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"371sh","text":"Any other condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, may preclude the subject from safe participation in the study or compromise data integrity.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dfeav","text":"Protocol Deviations/Violations:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8adtn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"alt61","text":"Protocol violations and deviations will be summarized with descriptive statistics by category. A listing of all events will also be included. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ga0c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1egl","text":"Protocol deviations include, but are not limited to the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5j5df","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9kf","text":"Enrolling subjects in violation of eligibility criteria designed to ensure a specific subject population","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5esv","text":"Failing to collect data necessary to interpret primary endpoints","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da5g0","text":"Subject’s refusal to complete scheduled research activities","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8oejb","text":"Out-of-window study visits or study procedures","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34ohq","text":"Description of Treatment Groups","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66q0n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"iir9","text":"This protocol will enroll a total of approximately 111 participants who will be randomly assigned using a 1:1:1 allocation ratio to the two treatment arms of CLBS03 (2.5 x 106 cells/kg BW, 20 x 106 cells/kg BW) or placebo. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":174,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":196,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kace","text":"Treatment Assignment and Double Blinding","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8alpm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b2ej","text":"The study will be conducted as a double blind study. The participants and blinded study personnel will not be informed regarding the treatment assignment until the end of the study (after the end of study database lock), unless required by the DSMB or in case of emergency unblinding for safety reasons (see below). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"do8q0","text":"The investigator and investigator site personnel will also be blinded as to subject treatment assignment. Laboratories and other vendors performing assays for this protocol will also be blinded except for the laboratory performing the exploratory assays. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26ovd","text":"The sponsor personnel, including the study medical monitor or designee, involved in the study conduct will also be blinded to subject treatment assignment. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fd77","text":"The final randomization schedule will be generated prior to study enrollment by an unblinded statistician.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o1l6","text":"In an emergency situation where knowledge of the study treatment is critical to subject safety and will influence choice of treatment, the study treatment for that subject can be unblinded. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mj98","text":"The Investigator should make all reasonable efforts to notify the medical monitor and/or study manager prior to unblinding. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hq1d","text":"If unable to contact the medical monitor and/or study manager, the investigator must inform the medical monitor and/or study manager as soon as possible after unblinding.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9k639","text":"Investigational Product","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdo8s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tgej","text":"Additional information on the handling of investigational product, including instructions for infusion, can be found in the Investigational Product: Collection and Infusion Manual.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"lce1","text":"Description of IP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mm7o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftq47","text":"The investigational product refers to either dose of CLBS03 or placebo and will be manufactured at PCT, a Caladrius company. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qi58","text":"The CLBS03 cell product (autologous, ex vivo expanded Treg cells) will be prepared using a Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) process as described in the CLBS03 IB. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qh2c","text":"Briefly, buffy coat leukocytes are isolated using a SynGenX-LAB device and labeled with anti-CD4 microbeads for positive selection of CD4+ cells using a CliniMACS instrument. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":137,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ddmlk","text":"Cells are then stained with fluorescent-conjugated monoclonal antibodies to CD4, CD25 and CD127. The target CD4+CD25+CD127lo/- Treg cells are then purified by flow cytometric sorting on a Becton Dickinson Influx™ cell sorter and expanded in culture for 13 to 14 days using anti-CD3/CD28 microbeads (Dynabeads® CD3/CD28 CTS) and IL-2, resulting in an approximately 1,000-fold expansion of Treg cells. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":111,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":116,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":122,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85klc","text":"At the end of the 14-day culture period, washing and volume reduction are performed on a LOVO® cell processing device, and anti-CD3/CD28 Dynabeads are removed using a CliniMACS® instrument. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1n066","text":"Cells are then re-suspended in sterile USP infusion solution (0.5% human albumin USP in an equal mixture of USP Plasma-Lyte A and USP 5% dextrose / 0.45% sodium chloride [NaCl]) for intravenous infusion into the same (autologous) patient.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vf22","text":"The placebo includes the infusion solution only, composed of 0.5% human albumin USP in an equal mixture of USP Plasma-Lyte A and USP 5% dextrose / 0.45% sodium chloride [NaCl].","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49if1","text":"Packaging and Storage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3v3pa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m4ud","text":"CLBS03 (approximately 100 mL) will be contained in a sterile 150-mL infusion bag. The investigational product will be masked with an opaque cover to blind the treating medical staff and the study subject as to the possible identity of the product (Treg cells or placebo). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhm19","text":"CLBS03 is express-shipped to the clinical site in a shipping container validated to maintain temperature between 2 and 10°C. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5nqa","text":"CLBS03 will be stored in the shipping container in a secure, limited access area maintained at room temperature until immediately prior to administration.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al9qk","text":"Labeling","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42eti","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjq0h","text":"Labeling will comply with country-specific requirements for investigational product. The investigational product will be identified as a new drug, limited by federal law to investigational use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"680eo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91cig","text":"Labels for the investigational product will minimally contain the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9aeli","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff0up","text":"Protocol number","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93bka","text":"Subject number","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94hh1","text":"Product name","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a53gc","text":"Storage temperature","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d0ok","text":"Expiration date/time","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elmtq","text":"Caution statement(s) (i.e., “Caution: New Drug—Limited by Federal (or United States) law to investigational use”)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5elq7","text":"Sponsor information","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apsva","text":"Other additional information may be displayed as required by federal laws and regulations.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3srr0","text":"IP Infusion","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2fn5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mcj5","text":"The IP infusion procedure is described in detail in the IP Collection and Infusion Manual for the study. The site must not infuse the IP until it has been released for infusion by PCT Quality Assurance.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csv6v","text":"Investigational product must be infused on the same day of receipt and prior to the expiration date and time. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abjii","text":"All study subjects will be observed at the investigator site on the day of IP infusion (Day 0). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67q0p","text":"Prior to infusion, the investigator will evaluate the subject and ensure that all study assessments are completed (including review of any medical history, laboratory results, and previous/ongoing symptoms that would preclude IP infusion) per the Schedule of Study Assessments (Section 4) and reach a positive decision to proceed with the infusion.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71m99","text":"Approximately 30-90 min prior to initiation of transfusion, all study participants will be administered up to 650 mg oral acetaminophen (10-15 mg/kg/dose) and 25 mg to 50 mg oral diphenhydramine, depending on body weight (25 mg for subjects \u003c50 kg and 50 mg for subjects ≥50 kg), and provided there are no known previous allergies. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gq6k","text":"If the subject is allergic to either medication, the investigator can substitute an appropriate alternative regimen (e.g., ibuprofen, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf7i8","text":"Study personnel should wait until email receipt from PCT Quality Assurance (QA) regarding release for infusion before administration of the above listed medications.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8he1n","text":"The IP dose will be manufactured based on the subject’s weight at the time of screening (Visit 1). The study drug will be administered via a peripheral intravenous (IV) line primed with saline per the site’s established standard operating procedures. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41l65","text":"The study drug may be administered by peripheral IV line with a 23 gauge (or larger bore as tolerated) needle over approximately 30 minutes (± 10 minutes; actual infusion time may vary by subject). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2psdr","text":"Following IP infusion, the infusion bag, tubing and peripheral IV line will be flushed with normal saline to ensure complete dose is infused. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fud3a","text":"Subjects will be closely monitored for safety during and after the completion of the infusion of the study drug. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5nnej","text":"Clinical monitoring will include monitoring vital signs (see Step 15.3 Vital Signs) prior to IP infusion, and again 2 hours post IP infusion. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bll2e","text":"The investigator may implement additional procedures or increase the time or close monitoring if required for subject’s safety. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a6hj","text":"Emergency medical equipment and appropriately trained personnel, including advanced cardiac and life support (ACLS and/or PALS) crash cart, must be immediately available onsite.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s6qe","text":"Slowing or Pausing the Infusion","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38ebk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f7e6","text":"No infusion reactions from autologous expanded Treg infusion have been noted to date, in either Phase 1 study (i.e., UCSF or GMU studies). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c68ak","text":"Nonetheless, subjects will be monitored carefully until the resolution of infusion reaction in the case any infusion reaction, such as cytokine release syndrome (CRS) (or individual components including nausea, headache, tachycardia, hypotension, rash, or shortness of breath) occurs. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"298vq","text":"If such an event occurs, it will be handled in the following manner:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ar0n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4cle","text":"1. Mild Reactions (Grade 1)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r9pm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9n5j8","text":"For mild (grade 1) reactions per the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI-CTCAE)42, the cell infusion will be continued. The investigator shall take one or more of the following actions, depending on the type of the reaction:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":121,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3amen","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3evs","text":"Administer additional doses of antihistamine, and acetaminophen or ibuprofen.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jmsc","text":"Reduce the rate of infusion by 50% or more. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70lp","text":"For chills and rigors, meperidine may be considered.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hpm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r8h4","text":"2. Moderate or More Severe Reactions (Grade 2 or Higher)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1595","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9iibo","text":"For moderate or more severe reactions (grade 2 or higher), the study infusion will be interrupted. The investigator may administer additional medications as needed to provide symptomatic relief, such as anti-pyretics, antihistamine, bronchodilators, or normal saline. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ofh8","text":"If there is not prompt resolution of these events within 30 minutes, glucocorticoids may be considered at a dose of 0.5 mg/kg methylprednisolone intravenously, and may be repeated every 6 hours as needed if moderate or more severe reactions persist. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"460c8","text":"If the reaction disappears or becomes NCI-CTCAE grade 1, then the infusion may be restarted (prior to IP expiration). If the reaction reoccurs after the restart of the infusion at NCI-CTCAE grade 2 or higher, then the infusion will be permanently discontinued. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52bfv","text":"If severity persists at NCI-CTCAE grade 2 or higher despite the above medications for more than 3 hours, then the infusion will be permanently discontinued. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e481r","text":"The above guidelines are meant to help the investigator with the clinical management of the subject. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3a8b9","text":"The investigator should attempt to contact the study medical monitor in case of additional questions or concerns. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ee00t","text":"Finally, the investigator has the right to modify the above guidelines or follow a different course of action if deemed necessary to safeguard the subject’s safety.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"777u3","text":"Investigational Product Accountability","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdq75","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9g53","text":"The investigator will ensure that the IP is stored as specified in the protocol (Step 11.2) and that the storage area is secured, with access limited to authorized study personnel. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80vat","text":"The investigator will maintain records that the IP was received, including the date received, IP identity code, date of manufacture or expiration date, amount received, and disposition. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4og5a","text":"Records will be maintained that include the subject’s initials and subject identification code (SIC), dispensation date, and amount dispensed. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7j5t2","text":"All remaining partially used and/or unused IP will be returned to the sponsor or sponsor’s representative or destroyed with the permission of the sponsor in accordance with applicable laws and study site procedures. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l36q","text":"If the IP is to be destroyed, the investigator will provide documentation in accordance with sponsor’s specifications.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6go5","text":"Outcome Measures","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aids8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5egi1","text":"During the course of the study, participants will frequently undergo assessments of their insulin production, immunologic status, and overall health and well-being (see Schedule of Assessments, Section 4). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1p6u","text":"Investigator or his/her delegate will be required to review, critically evaluate, and record the amount of insulin subjects have used, as well as glucose levels, during the 3-day period immediately preceding pre-specified study visits (for additional details, see Step 21 Intensive Diabetes Management and Section 4. Schedule of Assessments). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sccp","text":"Diaries will be provided to participants at specified study visits and reviewed and collected at the next visit. Subjects on an insulin pump will provide outputs of their insulin pump activity for the diary days. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23ttf","text":"Depending on the participants’ age, a parent or guardian may oversee the collection of data on the diary or assist with making outputs of insulin pump activity available to the investigator or his/her delegate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3melb","text":"Subjects who volunteer to undergo CGM and with access to a CGM device will provide downloads on a regular basis. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"597t","text":"Generally, these downloads will occur at the time of diary data collection but downloads may occur at other visits or may occur without a clinic visit either by mailing a used glucose sensor to the clinic for download or by providing a download via the internet. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8ld6","text":"Methods for data transfer will be established with patients and/or a parent or guardian on a case-by-case basis.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

All randomized subjects will be followed for safety and efficacy for approximately 104 weeks after treatment. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Tanner stage will be re-evaluated at 12 and 24 months if not already documented as ≥ stage III at a previous exam.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66kcr","text":"At screening, physical examination abnormalities deemed clinically significant by the investigator, should be recorded as medical history. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dinup","text":"At subsequent study visits, if a new abnormal or worsened abnormal pre-existing condition is detected, the condition will be recorded as an adverse event.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3f5l4","text":"Vital Signs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vtbv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lrg0","text":"Vital signs will include body temperature (ºC), respiratory rate (breaths/min), pulse rate (beats/min), systolic and diastolic blood pressure (mmHg), height, and weight. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3291b","text":"Blood pressure and pulse rate measurements will be measured after the subject has rested for at least 5 minutes. Blood pressure should be performed in the same position and measured using the same arm for the duration of the study when possible. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dv9op","text":"On the day of IP infusion, vitals will be taken before infusion and again 2-hours post-infusion (vital signs assessment 2 hours post-infusion will not include height and weight). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acjib","text":"BMI z-score will be determined for eligibility using the charts provided in Appendix 17.3. To determine BMI z-score, the subject’s BMI, weight and gender must be available. BMI can bederived using the formula below:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vckr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fglh","text":"BMI = (weight in kg)/(height in m)2, OR","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":34,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dlm4","text":"BMI = (weight in lb)/(height in in)2 x 703","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":35,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7b9af","text":"Hematology","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62jai","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"519nr","text":"The hematology panel will consist of complete blood count (hemoglobin, hematocrit, erythrocytes [i.e., red blood cell count], and leukocytes [i.e., white blood cell count]) with differential (i.e., basophils, eosinophils, lymphocytes, monocytes, and neutrophils), platelet counts, prothrombin time (PT; sec) or international normalized ratio (INR), and activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT; sec). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57juq","text":"Coagulation assays will only be performed at baseline. A limited hematology assessment will be performed at the treatment visit (Day 0), which will only include the complete blood count (CBC) with differential, and platelet counts. Hematology can be evaluated in either the fed or fasted state.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0e9p","text":"Clinical Chemistry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk0e0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nbdd","text":"The clinical chemistry panel will consist of C-reactive protein (CRP), creatinine, estimated glomerular filtration rate (e-GRF), creatine kinase (CK), electrolytes (sodium, potassium, chloride, calcium, magnesium, and phosphate), bicarbonate, total protein (T-pro), albumin, ALT, total bilirubin (T-bil), alkaline phosphatase (ALP), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), blood urea nitrogen (BUN), lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), total cholesterol (t-cho), high-density lipoprotein (HDL), low-density lipoprotein (LDL), triglyceride (TG), and glucose. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"basok","text":"Clinical chemistry will be evaluated in the fasted state.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"rdh8","text":"Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6umm1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a86b4","text":"HbA1c can be evaluated in either the fed or fasted state.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ptff","text":"Other tests","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ha4n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3iclg","text":"At screening, blood may also be collected for the tests described below. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cistj","text":"Blood will be collected to determine the regulatory T-cell count to satisfy the requirement for manufacturing of investigational product. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fpgh","text":"Virology testing (including human immunodeficiency virus [HIV] 1/2, hepatitis B, hepatitis C, human T-lymphotropic virus [HTLV] 1/2, Epstein-Barr virus [EBV], cytomegalovirus [CMV]) will be performed for eligibility determination. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8748m","text":"Whole-blood quantitative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) for EBV and CMV viral load will also be assessed as part of the screening procedures and then as necessary after treatment only when a subject is symptomatic. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1gcq","text":"Additionally, QuantiFERON test or PPD skin test may be performed to rule out tuberculosis.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6425i","text":"For eligibility determination, an autoantibody analysis will be performed to ensure that the subject is positive for at least one islet cell autoantibody as specified in the inclusion criteria.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9mov1","text":"Mixed Meal Tolerance Test (MMTT)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9gf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4rl9","text":"The MMTT will be performed in the morning, where a mixed meal will be administered and blood collected up to 250 minutes. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ol0s","text":"The 4-hour MMTT should take 250 minutes to perform, and the 2-hour MMTT should take 130 minutes. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ulq7","text":"Refer to the Appendix (Section Mixed Meal Tolerance Test) for details on the MMTT. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bafit","text":"Urinalysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ukjp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eiamj","text":"The urinalysis panel will consist of protein, occult blood, glucose, urobilinogen, bilirubin, ketones, and sediments. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"j9u1","text":"Pregnancy Testing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16mae","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aj3s","text":"Urine pregnancy testing for human chorionic gonadotrophin (hCG) will be performed on female subjects of childbearing potential.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49hnd","text":"Informed Assent/Consent and Enrollment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9n4ai","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2rpm","text":"Subjects will be enrolled when they have provided informed assent/consent to participate in the study, met all inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria, completed the screening visit, and have been randomized.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"av4p7","text":"Subject Identification Code (SIC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6n4rh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"begd6","text":"The subject identification code will be a 3-digit site number-3-digit subject number (e.g., 111-002) reflecting the order in which ICFs were signed. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9hm2","text":"For example, the third subject who signed an informed consent form at study site 002 will be identified as Subject 002-003. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bun0d","text":"All study documents and related material (e.g., electronic case report forms [CRFs], clinical documentation, sample containers, drug accountability logs, etc.) will be identified with the SIC.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f87cj","text":"Screening","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crpev","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7prnl","text":"Enrolled subjects must meet all inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria, and have completed all screening procedures prior to the blood draw for Treg collection at Visit 2. Subjects who have failed the screening process and have not been randomized will be recorded as a screen failure. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1adni","text":"Re-screening of subjects is allowed, at the discretion of the investigator with prior approval from the study sponsor, unless there are clinical implications that impact the ability of subject to meet selection criteria change.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8foju","text":"Randomization","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhq2j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"671q8","text":"Subjects will be randomized once all screening procedure results are available and it’s confirmed that the study eligibility requirements are met based on screening. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amp5d","text":"Eligibility requirements will be confirmed at Visit 2 prior to blood draw for Treg collection/IP manufacture.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afoi4","text":"Randomization of eligible subjects will be performed using the Interactive Response Technology (IRT) system. Sites will log into the IRT system (Clincapture) to obtain the randomization code for the subject. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tump","text":"The randomization allocation ratio will be 1:1:1. Randomization will be done centrally with stratification by screening MMTT-stimulated C-peptide AUC mean value. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dslhe","text":"Details regarding the randomization assignment will be discussed in the Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29lmk","text":"Blood Collection for CLBS03 Manufacturing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnprh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf9gj","text":"Blood will be collected (approximately 6 mL/kg up to 540 mL based on weight at Visit 2 [pretreatment visit]) from the designated study subject via phlebotomy for Treg isolation and expansion to generate the CLBS03 cell product. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17omn","text":"Blood is collected into standard CPD (citrate-phosphate-dextrose) blood collection bag(s) following standard clinical procedures. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eev3q","text":"The bag(s) is labeled with the subject's unique subject randomization code / identifier number. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6alug","text":"The blood is packaged in a shipping box validated to maintain temperature between 15 to 30°C and express-shipped with a temperature monitoring device to the PCT (Mountain View, CA) facility for processing of Treg cells. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a37jo","text":"Blood collected that is not used for CLBS03 manufacturing (i.e., blood from control subjects) may be used for optimizing Treg processing techniques, such as Treg expansion and stability extension of the CLBS03 products. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c5tt","text":"Additional details on the blood collection process can be found in the Investigational Product: Collection and Infusion Manual.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f31rk","text":"Diabetes Management","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhaj6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kvm0","text":"During the study, all participants are expected to be receiving intensive management of their diabetes, and HbA1c will be assessed every 3 months to evaluate metabolic control. The goal of treatment will be to maintain the HbA1c level as close to normal as possible, without frequent occurrence of hypoglycemia. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t31m","text":"All individuals should strive for targets in accordance with current ADA recommendations, with HbA1c levels of \u003c7.5% in children under the age of 19 years, and with preprandial glucose levels of 90-130 mg/dL, postprandial levels of less than 180 mg/dL, and bedtime levels of 90-150 mg/dL.39 ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":288,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbhdp","text":"All participants will be expected to take a sufficient number of daily insulin injections to meet the glycemic targets. In general, the expectation is that all participants will receive at least four injections of insulin daily, including short- and long-acting insulin preparations, or will utilize continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"426oe","text":"All participants will be expected to manage their diabetes with an insulin pump if possible. Glucose levels should be checked frequently, at a minimum of 4 times per day (before each meal and at bedtime). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rciq","text":"Subjects who are willing and have access to a continuous glucose monitoring device are strongly encouraged to monitor their blood glucose in this way. The outputs from these devices will occur at regular intervals and will be used in exploratory data analyses. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8e05a","text":"Depending on the participants’ age, parent or guardian involvement to obtain these device outputs may be necessary. Subjects will not be permitted to use non-insulin pharmaceuticals for glycemic control.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b00a5","text":"The primary responsibility for diabetes management will reside with the treating or referring diabetes care provider. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l9m","text":"The study team will provide close additional support through regular interaction, and records of the glucose levels and insulin dosing will be evaluated by the study team at regularly scheduled study visits.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"85ph8","text":"Subject Diaries","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahgve","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rvmd","text":"Participants will be required to record the amount and the type of insulin they have used, as well as blood glucose levels during the 3-day period immediately preceding each pre-specified study visit. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dd3","text":"Subject diaries will be provided to participants at select study visits (see Section 4) and reviewed and collected at the next visit. Subjects will be instructed to document all insulin administrations and glucose assessments during the 3-day period. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fiue7","text":"Depending on the participants’ age, a parent or guardian may oversee the collection of data on the diary. Subjects on an insulin pump will bring outputs of their insulin pump activity for the diary days. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mdv5","text":"Subjects using CGM will provide data downloads. Sites will contact the subject for diary completion approximately 4 days prior to the visit. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8p99v","text":"Depending on the participants’ age, parent or guardian involvement to obtain these device outputs may be necessary.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3m4q","text":"Procedures for Monitoring Subject Compliance","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59a5g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6iaq","text":"All study procedures are to be performed by the investigator or under his/her designation to a sub-investigator or study team member.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ane1l","text":"Withdrawal from Study","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u3qe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t842","text":"Discontinuation of, or partial treatment does not require subject withdrawal from participation in the study. Any subject may voluntarily withdraw consent for continued participation and data collection. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nsvd","text":"Reasons for discontinuation will be reported on the appropriate eCRF, including: screen failure, adverse event (e.g., death), discontinuation by subject (e.g., lost to follow-up [defined as 3 documented unsuccessful attempts to contact the subject], dropout), physician decision (e.g., pregnancy, progressive disease, non-compliance with IP/protocol violation(s), recovery), study terminated by sponsor, or other (reason to be specified by the investigator, e.g., technical problems). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cn4m","text":"Regardless of the reason, all data available for the subject up to the time of discontinuation should be recorded on the appropriate eCRF. The data collected on withdrawn subjects may be used in the analysis and included in the clinical study report.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1uttm","text":"Discontinuation (i.e., complete withdrawal from study participation) may be due to dropout (i.e., active discontinuation by subject) or loss to follow-up (i.e., discontinuation by subject without notice or action). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d1sm","text":"Additionally, the investigator and sponsor have the discretion to discontinue any subject from the study if judged that continued participation would pose an unacceptable risk for the subject. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gpuu","text":"In the event that the IP cannot be manufactured to meet release criteria, the subject will be terminated from the study prior to receiving treatment.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8jq1","text":"In the event of subject discontinuation from treatment due to an AE, additional clinical and/or laboratory investigations (that are beyond the scope of the required study observations/assessments) may be performed as part of the event evaluation. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bveqe","text":"These investigations will take place under the direction of the investigator in consultation with the sponsor, and the details of the outcome may be reported to the appropriate regulatory authorities by the sponsor or its designee. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hf8j","text":"In the event that a subject prematurely discontinues the study, site personnel should make all efforts to bring the subject back to the site to compete Visit 13 procedures.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m4br","text":"Risks and Potential Risks from Tregs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fvvk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rek1","text":"The autologous nature of Tregs that constitute CLBS03, and the equivalency in biologic function robustness between the expanded cells and freshly isolated Tregs, diminishes the possibility of a significant toxicity potential. Primary pharmacology animal studies also support this conclusion. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb8p5","text":"Because the potential toxicity of CD4+CD25+CD127lo/- Treg cell therapy cannot be evaluated in currently available mouse models, the data from early phase clinical trials provide the most relevant and clinically meaningful assessment of potential toxicity. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":37,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":42,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":48,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c79pb","text":"Based on this early clinical data, and other biologic and experimental considerations, the following risks outlined in the subsections below are the most relevant to CLBS03 administration.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk30m","text":"T-Cell Suppression","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0mm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70su","text":"There is accumulating data related to the clinical use of Tregs to treat T1DM and other autoimmune diseases. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4561r","text":"In mice, Tregs are known to suppress naïve T-cell responses to antigens. Less is known about ongoing immune responses, especially to viruses and bacteria; it is not known whether Tregs will alter protective immunity. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkes4","text":"In the GMU Phase 1 trial, previously immunized adolescents treated with Tregs (similar to CLBS03) maintained protective titers against hepatitis B virus (HBV) and rubella viruses; only one child was inadvertently immunized against HBV and mounted an appropriate serological response. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ctu7","text":"To date, no significant safety issues were identified in clinical trials with Tregs. In addition, appropriate subject selection criteria and clinical monitoring will be implemented in the CLBS03 clinical development program. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42suq","text":"It is advised that age appropriate vaccinations are current for enrolled subjects before receiving study drug (CLBS03 or placebo) (see Step 8.2, Exclusion Criteria). Subjects with active infections or CMV/EBV viremia will have to clear them before receiving study drug. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d23he","text":"At this time, subjects with certain chronic infections will be excluded from participation in the development program.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"flmke","text":"Transfusion Reaction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"env7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"coj02","text":"Side effects reported from previous human trials involving T-cell infusions include transient fever, chills, and/or nausea. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h72b","text":"Subjects will be administered acetaminophen and diphenhydramine hydrochloride prior to the infusion of Tregs (See Step 11.4, IP Infusion). These medications may be repeated every six hours as needed. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aotpd","text":"Participants will not receive systemic corticosteroids such as hydrocortisone, prednisone, prednisolone (Solu-Medrol®) or dexamethasone (Decadron®) unless deemed necessary by the medical team for subject safety. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec50o","text":"If corticosteroids are required for an acute infusion reaction, an initial dose of 0.5 mg/kg methylprednisolone should be used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24n55","text":"Loss of Immune Surveillance and Risk for Lymphoproliferative Disease ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":68}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dimjf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bglpv","text":"T lymphocytes are one major component of tumor surveillance and it is possible that cells that inhibit T lymphocytes could impair this tumor surveillance function. There is lack of conclusive evidence linking adoptive transfer of Tregs to cancer promotion. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kp0v","text":"The relationship between Tregs and cancer have been shown in preclinical and clinical observations; however, these observations were in established cancers, remain contradictory, and do not support a causal relationship of Tregs in de novo cancer promotion.43-45 ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":257,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59sib","text":"A relatively small degree of immune suppression is expected from a single administration of Tregs, but the experience from the two Phase 1 clinical trials minimizes this concern. Complications such as lymphoproliferative disease are a possible but unlikely concern with a single Treg infusion. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4ek1","text":"The Phase 1 T1DM study follow up data show no evidence of EBV reactivation (except for one subject who developed a primary CMV infection at the time of the Treg infusion and cleared the infection quickly through a normal clinical course). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ddlo","text":"As indicated in the exclusion criteria above (Step 8.2), subjects with evidence of EBV/CMV infections will have to clear viremia before receiving study drugs. In addition, close monitoring will be implemented during the clinical development program. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fi9q6","text":"Additionally, the long term follow-up of all treated participants will determine whether there is evidence of an increase in the frequency of tumors. To date, most subjects have completed more than 1 year follow up, and no issues have been noted in either Phase 1 clinical trial. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e05q","text":"Additional follow-up for subjects in both trials is currently ongoing and any significant findings related to this risk will be monitored in the clinical development program.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7itu0","text":"Worsening Diabetes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24t3p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dn88","text":"It is possible that Tregs could have an anti-islet effect and thus worsen diabetes. This may occur independently of whether the functional phenotype of the Tregs changes from a regulatory to an effector phenotype after in vivo adoptive transfer. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9faui","text":"However, this is likely to be mitigated by the relatively higher ratio of T-regulatory cells, the polyclonal nature of the infused cells, low islet antigen-specific precursor frequency in the preparation, and endogenous regulatory mechanisms. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nu23","text":"To date, there is no significant clinical evidence to support this potential, but any sign of worsening diabetes will be closely monitored by utilizing MMTT-stimulated C-peptide as an efficacy endpoint in the clinical development program for T1DM. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbjd5","text":"During the course of the trial, MMTT-stimulated C-peptide levels will be monitored by the DSMB.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9td8n","text":"Reproductive Risks","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eo0eg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86ktn","text":"There may be an unexpected risk to an unborn or nursing child. Pregnant and breastfeeding women will be excluded from participation in the study. Pregnancy testing will be performed on female subjects of childbearing potential and test results must be negative prior to treatment. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfa3c","text":"Females of child bearing potential (i.e., females who have reached puberty or have had their first menstrual bleeding) must: a) be surgically sterile, or b) be practicing an acceptable method of birth control for the duration of their participation in the study. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asqtd","text":"Acceptable methods of birth control are: oral contraceptive tablets, hormonal implant device, hormonal patch, intrauterine device, diaphragm and contraceptive cream or foam, condom with spermicide, or abstinence. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1o0h","text":"Males must also agree to use a reliable and accepted method of contraception for the duration of their participation in the study. Acceptable methods of birth control are: condom with spermicide, or abstinence.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fttsv","text":"At every study visit the sexual activity and contraceptive use of participants of reproductive age will be re-assessed. If a subject who was previously sexually inactive becomes sexually active, s/he will be counseled about the need to use a reliable and acceptable form of birth control. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1joa4","text":"Female subjects will also be required to undergo a urine pregnancy test at the screening visit (Visit 1, Day -79 to -23), pretreatment visit (Visit 2, Day -16), treatment visit (Visit 3, Day 0), and Visit 13 (Day 728). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63ial","text":"A positive pregnancy test will result in the subject being discontinued from the study. Refer to Step 34 for details in the event of subject pregnancy, and refer to Step 24, Withdrawal from Study for details regarding subject discontinuation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5a7p","text":"Procedure-Related Risks","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hgpa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgrhv","text":"The amount of blood required to be drawn for Treg collection/IP manufacture, and safety and efficacy monitoring could represent potential safety risks. There were no reports of related serious or severe AEs associated with blood volumes collected in the GMU Phase 1 trial in children. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqp9k","text":"Hemoglobin levels will be monitored throughout the trial. Additionally, the investigator(s) will recommend iron supplements to subjects who successfully complete the screening visit.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
