{"blocks":[{"key":"7kuvj","text":"Concomitant and Prohibited Medications","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dfao","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0cop","text":"The following medications are not permitted throughout the duration of the study: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgb80","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdh3c","text":"Use of non-insulin pharmaceuticals that affect glycemic control.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frvqv","text":"Use of systemic corticosteroids or other immuno-modulatory drugs. Topical corticosteroid and nasal steroid use should be consulted with the study sponsor prior to use. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36ico","text":"Vaccination with a live virus one year after Visit 3.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce990","text":"Vaccination with a killed virus 3 months after Visit 3.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1s546","text":"Expected Side Effects and Adverse Events ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dj7u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dbk6","text":"Mild upper respiratory tract infections could be expected since they were commonly observed in the adult Phase 1 study. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6chlu","text":"Mild drop in hemoglobin could be expected following blood collection for Treg collection/IP manufacture. This procedure was not associated with severe or serious AEs in the GMU Phase 1 study in adolescents. Hemoglobin will be monitored and supplementary iron will be administered. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8goq","text":"AEs related to metabolic control of T1DM are to be expected in this subject population, but at comparable rates to that for an age-matched population with new onset T1DM.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aaahv","text":"Adverse Event","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vsem","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2h7s","text":"All AEs will be recorded from the time of consent until study completion or discontinuation. An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a subject treated with the IP, regardless of a causal relationship with the treatment. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jeh8","text":"An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended  sign (including clinically significant abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of an IP, whether or not related to the IP. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5nkn","text":"Any clinically significant abnormal laboratory finding can be repeated before being reported as an AE. Any medical occurrence that leads to dosing interruption, subject discontinuation, or administration of concomitant medication for treatment will be considered an AE. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"foocb","text":"Each untoward medical occurrence experienced before the first treatment procedure (i.e., from the time of signed informed consent up to but not including the IP infusion) will be described on the AE eCRF. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aen5t","text":"Any untoward medical occurrence that qualifies as an SAE, regardless of study drug administration, will be recorded as an SAE on the eCRF, and reported according to the sponsor as outlined in Step 30 below.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61crq","text":"As hypoglycemic events are part of the natural course of T1DM, severe hypoglycemia (defined as an event requiring assistance of another person to actively administer carbohydrates, glucagon, or take other corrective actions) will be reported as an AE. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf4ek","text":"Non-severe hypoglycemia deemed clinically significant by the investigator may also be reported as an AE.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bjhtt","text":"Serious Adverse Event","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dofom","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ipvg","text":"A serious adverse event is defined as any adverse event resulting in any of the following outcomes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcvcq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2mhv","text":"Outcome is fatal/results in death","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffd3t","text":"Is life-threatening (at the time of the event)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1dhs","text":"Requires hospitalization or results in prolonged hospitalization","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72iqk","text":"Results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ivtd","text":"Results in congenital anomaly/birth defect","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3896u","text":"Is a medically important event that may not be immediately life-threatening or require hospitalization but may jeopardize the subject or may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the other outcomes listed in the definitions above (e.g., infection, allergic reaction, etc.)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtt19","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m4a8","text":"SAEs will be followed until resolution, medically stabilized, or 30 days after the end-of-study visit, whichever comes first. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcbet","text":"All SAEs are to be reported to INC Research within 24 hours of becoming aware of the event. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8eoo1","text":"To report an SAE or event of special interest, fax the report form to 1-877-464-7787 or email it to INCDrugSafety@incresearch.com.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1hdn0","text":"Events of Special Interest","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crrr7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13mlv","text":"Events of special interest will be captured for this study and include the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mutb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3p2ts","text":"Infusions prematurely stopped or paused due to an adverse event ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a7bc","text":"Severe hypoglycemia defined as an event requiring assistance of another person to actively administer carbohydrates, glucagon, or take other corrective actions","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1v5hc","text":"Infusion-related reactions resulting in discontinuation of infusion or requiring medical treatment","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o3m6","text":"Infections with severity of Grade 3 or worse; or any opportunistic infections (Grade 3 defined by NCI-CTCAE as severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self-care activities of daily living) ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"211pu","text":"Ketoacidosis","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6k7gu","text":"Cancer-related events","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u924","text":"C-peptide failure (defined as the first occurrence of 2-hour or 4-hour MMTT-stimulated C-peptide concentration \u003c0.2 pmol/mL). This will not be considered or reported as an AE as the information will be derived from C-peptide measures at the time of data analysis. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cf1p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avnls","text":"Events of special interest (except for C-peptide failure) will be followed similarly to SAEs and reported to INC Research employing the same process as for SAEs (see Step 30).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"as8sm","text":"Grading Event Severity and Causality","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fe14","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nabr","text":"The investigator will assess the severity of each AE using his/her clinical expertise and judgment based on the most appropriate description below, as recommended by NCI-CTCAE Version 4.03.42","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":189,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4omua","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lqat","text":"Grade 1 Mild; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jmsg","text":"Grade 2 Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental activities of daily living (preparing meals, shopping for groceries or clothes, using the telephone, managing money, etc.). ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f46bf","text":"Grade 3 Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self-care activities of daily living (bathing, dressing and undressing, feeding self, using the toilet, taking medications, and not bedridden). ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s34m","text":"Grade 4 Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5u93","text":"Grade 5 Death related to AE.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3iau","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fds3","text":"Causality is a determination of whether there is a reasonable possibility that the IP is etiologically related to/associated with the AE. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78oj9","text":"Causality assessment includes for example, assessment of temporal relationships, dechallenge/rechallenge information, association (or lack of association) with underlying disease, presence (or absence) of a more likely cause, and physiological plausibility. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dcbq","text":"For each AE, the investigator will assess three causal relationships to assess whether the AE was related to the blood collection procedure, the infusion procedure, or the investigational product. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u1fr","text":"The investigator will use his/her clinical expertise and judgment according to the following most appropriate algorithm for the circumstances of the AE:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"516n5","text":"Not related (both circumstances must be met)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19mpf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q5qv","text":"Is due to underlying or concurrent illness, complications, concurrent treatments, or effects of concurrent drugs","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c61m4","text":"Is not related (i.e., does not follow a reasonable temporal relationship or has a much more likely alternative etiology). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3op32","text":"Unlikely related (either one or both circumstances are met)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"499kt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ec3j","text":"Has little or no temporal relationship ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1d63","text":"A more likely alternative etiology exists","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80k94","text":"Possibly related (both circumstances must be met)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el1ko","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bojjj","text":"Follows a reasonable temporal relationship","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fk3eg","text":"An alternative etiology is equally or less likely compared to the potential relationship","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1vcfc","text":"Probably related (both circumstances must be met)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mf7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dva3h","text":"Follows a strong temporal relationship","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aek1b","text":"Another etiology is unlikely or significantly less likely","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65vad","text":"Pre-existing Diseases","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5bi4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5egvd","text":"Pre-existing diseases that are present before entry in to the study (as described in the medical history) will not be recorded as AEs, but will be documented as part of the subject’s initialmedical history. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aluco","text":"Pre-existing diseases that manifest with the same severity, frequency, or duration after IP exposure also will not be recorded as AEs, but will be documented in the subject initial history. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95dl3","text":"However, when there is an increase in the severity or duration of a preexisting disease, the event must be described as an AE, and recorded on the eCRF.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1lshp","text":"Pregnancy","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l1fh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nt6o","text":"Pregnancy is not considered to be an AE or an SAE, unless a complication occurs that meets the requirements for an AE or SAE, but must be reported on a pregnancy report form. Female subjects who are pregnant or likely to become pregnant are excluded from this study. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9uf6k","text":"In the event a subject becomes pregnant during the study, a pregnancy report form must be completed to capture potential drug exposure during pregnancy, and the pregnancy must be reported within 24 hours of notice. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb2p8","text":"For subjects who exit the study prematurely, pregnancies occurring up to 90 days after study treatment should be reported. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dccsi","text":"Any pregnant subject must be followed until the outcome of her pregnancy is known (i.e., normal delivery, abnormal delivery, spontaneous/voluntary/therapeutic abortion). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ae11","text":"The pregnancy (i.e., the mother and the fetus) must be followed through delivery with regard to outcome.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"coqjc","text":"Adverse Event Reporting and Monitoring ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"besc1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7di9n","text":"All AEs will be recorded from the time of consent until study completion or discontinuation. For subjects who exit the study prematurely, SAEs occurring up to 90 days after study treatment should be reported. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7luoe","text":"All AEs will be described using the sign, symptom, or medical diagnosis (where available, medical diagnosis is preferred over symptom) on the AE eCRF in standard medical terminology in order to avoid the use of vague, ambiguous, or colloquial expressions. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b96im","text":"Each AE will be defined as a SAE or non-serious AE according to the definitions in Section Adverse event reporting and safety monitoring. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24qr0","text":"Both serious and non-serious AEs will be followed until resolution, medically stabilized or 30 days after the end-of-study visit, whichever occurs first. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvh5e","text":"All SAEs are to be reported to the INC Research within 24 hours of becoming aware of the event.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fb8ct","text":"Assessment of Adverse Events","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4evcu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64f59","text":"Each AE will be evaluated by the investigator for:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2jc5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vsh0","text":"Seriousness as defined in Step 30","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fftlc","text":"Severity as defined in Step 31","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0o61","text":"Causal relationship to IP exposure as defined in Step 31","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"glam","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1orh","text":"For each AE, the outcome (e.g., recovering/resolving, recovered/resolved, recovered/resolved with sequelae, not recovered/not resolved, fatal) and action taken will also be recorded on the AE eCRF. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccs9l","text":"Recovering/resolving AEs will be followed until resolution, medically stabilized, or 30 days after the end-of-study visit, whichever comes first.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"32lr9","text":"Enrollment will be completed in 2 parts. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftnmm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ijot","text":"For Part 1 approximately 18 subjects will be initially randomized, at a 1:1:1 ratio, to all treatment arms. After subjects enrolled in Part 1 have reached the 28-day post-treatment visit, a safety review will be conducted. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1krj","text":"If the safety profile is deemed acceptable, enrollment in Part 2 will be allowed. An additional safety review will take place once subjects enrolled in Part 1 have reached the 3-month post-treatment visit. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5sal6","text":"The additional subjects will be enrolled in Part 2 and randomized to all treatment arms at a ratio of 1:1:1 to reach a total enrollment of approximately 111 subjects.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68ddr","text":"The randomization allocation ratio will be 1:1:1 and will be done centrally with stratification by screening MMTT-stimulated C-peptide AUC mean value.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5mocf","text":"Analysis Populations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5i6l4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7h053","text":"Several analysis populations will be defined for this trial for the summaries and analyses of the study data.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dd41","text":"The Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population will consist of all randomized subjects who receive a study treatment. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ss86","text":"Subjects will be analyzed according to the treatment to which they were randomized, even if they received a different treatment or less than a full dose of the assigned treatment. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g9dl","text":"The ITT population will be used for subject demographics and efficacy analyses. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72cpa","text":"The modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) population will consist of all randomized subjects who receive a study treatment and have at least one post-treatment assessment, with their treatment group designation defined by the actual numbers of Treg cells dosed, which will be further defined in the SAP. This population will be used for efficacy analyses.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hds0","text":"The Per-Protocol (PP) population will consist of all randomized subjects who receive the correct dose of the randomized study treatment and have at least one post-treatment assessment, have MMTT-stimulated C-peptide levels assessed at day 182 (week 26), and do not have any major protocol violations. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brb4d","text":"This population will exclude subjects who receive less than the intended treatment dose. The PP population will be used for subject demographics and as a supportive analysis for the primary and secondary efficacy analyses.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16avl","text":"The Safety population will consist of all subjects who receive study treatment, analyzed according to the treatment they received. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60nq9","text":"Further details on the definitions of the analysis populations will be provided in a prospectively developed statistical analysis plan (SAP).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"beif2","text":"Study Endpoints","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j9fr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25s6g","text":"Primary Endpoints","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amsci","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"311tv","text":"The primary study endpoint is the 4-hour MMTT-stimulated C-peptide AUC mean at 26 and 52 weeks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dglt4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dgtl","text":"Secondary Endpoints ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b43n3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"io28","text":"The 2-hour MMTT-stimulated C-peptide AUC mean at 13, 26, 52, 78 and 104 weeks and the 4-hour MMTT-stimulated C-peptide AUC mean at 104 weeks.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dndjg","text":"Additional metabolic evaluations will include a comparison between the study treatment groups in:","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3kkqk","text":"DDI as measured by U/kg BW at weeks 4, 13, 26, 39, 52, 78 and 104.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"745dk","text":"Severe hypoglycemia, defined as an event requiring assistance of another person to actively administer carbohydrates, glucagon, or take other corrective actions, occurring from the time of treatment through weeks 13, 26, 52, 78 and 104.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pbl5","text":"HbA1c levels measured at 13, 26, 39, 52, 78 and 104 weeks. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60hjs","text":"Fasting blood glucose levels at weeks 13, 26, 52, 78 and 104 (based on MMTT).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1jjf","text":"Post-prandial (2-hour post meal) blood glucose levels at weeks 13, 26, 52, 78 and 104 (based on MMTT).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"els2q","text":"Proportion of subjects who achieve partial remission, as defined by persistent reduction in exogenous insulin administration preceding weeks 13, 26, 52, 78 and 104. This will be further defined in the SAP.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ee8","text":"Proportion of subjects who achieve complete remission, as defined by freedom from exogenous insulin adminsitration preceding weeks 13, 26, 52, 78 and 104. This will be further defined in the SAP.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jr3t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3tfk","text":"Continuous Glucose Monitoring","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3b8g4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98m0d","text":"Serum glucose data from CGM devices will be examined for a subset of patients who are willing to use a CGM device and have access to a continuous glucose monitoring device. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9vnh","text":"As the science of CGM is still evolving and there is no consensus on the best way to examine these data, these analyses are considered exploratory. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csnhd","text":"Particular attention will be paid to observations of low and high glucose levels and the pattern of fluctuations in serum glucose over the course of the study. Additional details will be provided in the SAP.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n24r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i1f0","text":"Exploratory Biomarker Assays","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6veuf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1iqp","text":"Exploratory analyses will be conducted to assess the effect of CLBS03 on the pathologic autoimmune response underlying T1DM and on general immune responsiveness. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcag4","text":"The following parameters may be evaluated (see Step 7.5 for further details on the assays): 1) assessment of immune cell subset and intracellular cytokine profile, 2) cytokine analysis, 3) autoantibody analysis, 4) whole blood DNA epigenetic studies, 5) whole blood genomic studies, 6) CLBS03 tracking by stable isotope labeling, 7) functional cell based assays on cryopreserved samples, and 8) potential additional exploratory assays. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af8nh","text":"Descriptive and analytical statistical methods will be used to assess the significance of any observations. Additional details will be provided in the SAP. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gdcg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t88u","text":"Safety Endpoints ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eegck","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"234md","text":"The primary safety endpoints are treatment emergent adverse events (TEAE), SAEs, and events of special interest. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rjgg","text":"Additional safety and tolerability endpoints include clinical laboratory tests, physical examination findings, concomitant medications, and vital signs.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3f83v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"838uo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmmq3","text":"Demographic and Baseline Characteristics","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67trl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1fqm","text":"Demographic and relevant baseline characteristics will be presented and summarized descriptively by treatment for the various analysis populations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dm1t","text":"Statistical Analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ap92t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9oltl","text":"1.  General Considerations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64rgl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qtkq","text":"Baseline: Baseline refers to the last measurement collected on or prior to study treatment at Visit 3. Subjects with missing baseline data will have their baseline values imputed by the mean baseline value of subjects with baseline values.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ffc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2ajn","text":"Type 1 Error for Multiple Comparisons: This is a Phase 2 exploratory study and thus there will be no adjustment of type 1 errors arising from multiple comparisons. All statistical analyses will be conducted at the 2-sided 0.05 significance levels. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6stn","text":"All collected data will be listed. A detailed SAP will be written and approved prior to database lock.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48ptg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ceoc8","text":"2.  Analyses of the Primary Endpoints","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbpi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pvm1","text":"The AUC mean of 4-hour MMTT-stimulated C-peptide is defined as the AUC for the 4-hour MMTT-stimulated C-peptide divided by the actual time span the samples are collected during the target 4-hour period. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ukv9","text":"The AUC will be calculated using the trapezoidal rule. Similarly, the AUC mean of 2-hour MMTT-stimulated C-peptide is defined as the AUC for the 2-hour MMTT-stimulated C-peptide divided by the actual time span the samples are collected during the target 2-hour period. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drtul","text":"The unit for AUC mean is pmol/mL.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebtkn","text":"Data will be examined for normality and may or may not be log-transformed according to best statistical practice. In the event of log-transformation, the primary endpoint of 4-hour AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide will be log-transformed by the formula loge(x+1) before analyses1. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":261,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":283,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahbbu","text":"The baseline value of AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide is collected at screening (Visit 1). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73tfs","text":"The change in AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide from baseline to Week 26 and Week 52 will be summarized descriptively by treatment. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gjrt","text":"The mean values will be transformed back to the original scale by the formula exp(y)-1 to yield the inversed mean and inversed median. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o5li","text":"The 2-hour AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide will be summarized similarly. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5dan","text":"The change in 4-hour AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide from baseline Week 26 and Week 52 will be analyzed by a mixed-effect model with repeated measures (MMRM). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ivgh","text":"The MMRM model will include the change in AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide as the dependent variable; treatment, C-peptide stratum, visit, and treatment-by-visit interaction as fixed effects; and subject as a random effect. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vpgr","text":"Baseline 4-hour AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide will be included as a covariate. All observed AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide data from post-baseline scheduled visits (including early termination visits) will be included in the MMRM analysis. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37t03","text":"In addition, if a subject’s last available measurement during the 52-week assessment period is from an unscheduled visit or early termination visit, the value will be programmatically mapped to the next closest scheduled visit and included in the MMRM analysis. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kse9","text":"The MMRM model will employ an unstructured covariance matrix unless it does not converge; alternative covariance structures will then be examined and the Akaike information criterion (AIC) will be used to determine the best fit. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o0de","text":"The least squares (LS) mean of the change from baseline in log-transformed 4-hour AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide will be calculated for each treatment at each visit together with the 95% confidence intervals. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73juo","text":"The LS mean difference between each treatment and placebo of the change from baseline in log-transformed 4-hour AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide will also be calculated at each visit together with the 95% confidence intervals. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75de6","text":"The above LS means and the 95% confidence intervals will be transformed back to the original scale using the formula exp(y)-1 to yield the inversed LS means and the corresponding 95% confidence intervals.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bm6f","text":"A regression analysis will also be conducted to study the dose-response relationship between the actual dose (actual number of cells per kg) and the primary endpoints of AUC means. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72q58","text":"If log-normally distributed, the AUC means will be log-transformed as in the primary analysis before being analyzed. The regression model will also include other exploratory variables that may have an impact on the primary endpoint. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15c45","text":"The list of variables will include age, time since diagnosis of T1DM, gender, body weight at baseline, baseline MMTT-stimulated C-peptide, baseline HbA1c, etc. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejc4m","text":"A step-wise model selection method may be used to eliminate variables that are deemed not important or be confounded with other key variables. More detail will be provided in the SAP.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h50j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2kjc","text":"3.  Analysis of the Secondary Endpoints","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2frvv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9js9i","text":"The changes in the secondary endpoints of 2-hour AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide from baseline will be analyzed in a similar manner as described above for the analysis of the primary endpoint whereby the response variable and the independent variables will include values at 13, 26, 52, 78, and 104 weeks.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4omtv","text":"The change in the secondary endpoint of 4-hour AUC mean of MMTT-stimulated C-peptide from baseline will be analyzed in a similar manner as described above for the analysis of the primary endpoint whereby the response variable and the independent variables will include values at 104 weeks.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23i5t","text":"The daily dose of insulin and HbA1c will be summarized and analyzed similarly as for the primary efficacy endpoints without the log-transformation. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4umpq","text":"Severe hypoglycemia will be summarized by incidence and event rate adjusted by patient year of observation. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rovu","text":"The change from baseline in the secondary endpoints of fasting plasma glucose and the 2-hour post-prandial glucose measured by MMTT at Weeks 13, 26, 52, 78, and 104 will be analyzed in a similar manner as for the analysis of the secondary endpoint of the 2-hour AUC mean C-peptide. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jmun","text":"Proportion of subjects who achieve partial remission will be summarized by visit and analyzed for treatment comparisons using Fisher’s exact tests by visit. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eic9n","text":"In addition, logistic regressions will be used to analyze the proportion by visit whereby the baseline 4-hour AUC mean MMTT-stimulated C-peptide will be included as a covariate. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2krtc","text":"Proportion of subjects who achieve complete remission will be summarized and analyzed in the same manner as for partial remission. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"db7ch","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bvrt","text":"4. Analysis of the Safety Endpoints","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2qjh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6me5r","text":"The analysis of safety data will be performed for the Safety Population unless otherwise stated. The primary safety and tolerability endpoints are the incidence of TEAEs.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1i1mr","text":"Adverse Events","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eo0j1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1isjo","text":"Treatment-emergent adverse events will be defined as those occurring during or after administration of randomized study treatment on Visit 3 or existing prior to the time of and worsening after the time of the dose of randomized study treatment through study termination or early termination. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bpnk","text":"Adverse events prior to the dose of randomized study treatment on Visit 3 will be classified as pretreatment (non-treatment-emergent). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s7dc","text":"Treatment-emergent AEs will be summarized by treatment, system organ class, and preferred term defined by the Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA®). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ks7","text":"The number of events, the number of subjects, and the percent of subjects who experienced at least one TEAE will be presented for each system organ class and for each preferred term by treatment group. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3f4m7","text":"TEAEs that lead to early withdrawals and serious TEAEs will be summarized in the same manner. Additional details will be provided in the SAP.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d96gq","text":"Clinical Laboratory Evaluations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9iddr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br1e2","text":"All hematology, clinical chemistry and urinalysis data will be listed by treatment, subject, and visit, including scheduled and unscheduled/repeat measurements. Laboratory assessments that are outside of normal ranges will be flagged. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcejk","text":"Baseline values, the values at each visit, and changes from baseline values will be summarized for each of the quantitative laboratory assessments by treatment. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmeuj","text":"Shift tables of hematology, clinical chemistry, and urinalysis results will be used to summarize changes from baseline to study termination (or early termination).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4bvps","text":"Sample Size and Power Estimation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tekt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dc55p","text":"The goal of this study, assuming that safety is acceptable, is to determine if there is sufficient evidence of clinically meaningful bioactivity to proceed with further development. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hcg8","text":"Since there are no prior data in the current study population, sample size estimation was performed based on projected difference in the decreases in the 4-hour AUC mean MMTT-stimulated C-peptide in the control and active treatment groups at the Week 52 visit. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b80","text":"The following assumptions are used in sample size estimation for this study:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dq5l9","text":"The baseline 4-hour AUC mean MMTT-stimulated C-peptide value is approximately 0.768 pmol/mL for all three groups. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bng9l","text":"The root mean square error (RMSE) or the within treatment group standard deviation for the end value of 4-hour AUC mean for all treatments at Week 52 (day 364) is σ=0.204 at the loge(x+1) scale. The information comes from Table 5 in Lachin et al.1","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":181,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":246,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21igi","text":"The sample size calculation is conducted at the loge(x+1) scale. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":51,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4o8bd","text":"All statistical testing is done at a two-sided significance level of 0.05.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqokf","text":"A sample size of 33 subjects per treatment group will provide approximately 80% power to detect a 0.2 pmol/mL difference in the 4-hour AUC mean MMTT-stimulated C-peptide between an active treatment and the placebo with a two-sample t-test at a two-sided 0.05 significance level. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d2df","text":"A sample size of 33 subjects per treatment group will also provide at least 85% power to show a statistically significant correlation between the log-transformed 4-hour AUC mean MMTT-stimulated C-peptide at the Week 52 visit and the actual dose (actual number of cells per kg) assuming that the true correlation is 0.3. Statistical significance of the correlation is equivalent to statistical significance of the dose-response (regression) analysis of the log-transformed 4-hour AUC mean MMTT-stimulated C-peptide at the Week 52 visit with respect to the actual dose.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bttai","text":"Additionally, the same sample size will provide approximately 66% power for detecting a 50% attenuation in the decrease of the 4-hour AUC mean MMTT-stimulated C-peptide between an active treatment and the placebo with a two-sample t-test for the log-transformed 4-hour AUC mean MMTT-stimulated C-peptide at a 2-sided significance level of 0.05. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ddc3c","text":"Assuming a 10% dropout rate by week 26, 37 subjects per group need to be randomized.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"66vk3","text":"Interim Analysis Plan","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2o0ai","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sh0p","text":"A formal interim analysis allowing for early termination for futility will be conducted. The study will not be stopped for demonstrating statistically significant efficacy at the interim analysis. Therefore, there will be no adjustment of type 1 error associated with the interim analysis. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"euqhm","text":"As the target sample size is 111 subjects, the planned interim analyses will be conducted after approximately 50% of the total planned sample size have observed Week 26 assessments. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8uoeq","text":"The detailed definition of the futility criterion will be defined in the prospective SAP that will be finalized prior to the formal interim analysis.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2lie9","text":"Vital Signs and Physical Examinations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv3cj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8kgf","text":"Vital signs at baseline, each scheduled visit, and changes from baseline values will be summarized by treatment. Clinical significant physical examination findings will be listed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4n0sr","text":"Study Documentation and Case Report Forms (CRFs)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5ltv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a9em","text":"The data collection tool for this study will be sponsor defined eCRFs to be completed by study-site personnel. The investigator will maintain complete and accurate study documentation in a separate file. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76l6q","text":"Study documentation may include medical records, records detailing the progress of the study for each subject, signed informed consent forms, drug disposition records, correspondence with the Institutional Review Board (IRB) and the study monitor/sponsor, screening and consent information, CRFs, SAE reports, laboratory reports, subject diaries, data clarifications requested by the sponsor or designee, and any other documentation deemed relevant and pertinent to the study and the study subjects. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej9c8","text":"Subject data necessary for analysis and reporting will be entered into a validated database or data system in accordance with Title 21 of the Code of Federal Regulations (21 CFR) Part 11. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv1hn","text":"Clinical data management will be performed by a sponsor assigned data management vendor in accordance with applicable data management vendor standards and data cleaning procedures. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2jf3","text":"The investigator is responsible for the procurement of data and for the quality of data recorded on the eCRFs. The eCRF will be electronically signed by the investigator listed on Form FDA 1572.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjd50","text":"The handling of data by the sponsor and the data management vendor, including data quality assurance, will comply with regulatory guidelines (e.g., International Council on Harmonisation Guideline for Good Clinical Practice E6 [ICH GCP]) and the standard operating procedures of the sponsor or designee. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t33a","text":"Data management and control processes specific to the study will be described in the Data Management Plan.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7klc4","text":"Document and Data Retention","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h82m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qco1","text":"The investigator will retain study documentation and data (electronic case report forms) in accordance with applicable regulatory requirements and the document and data retention policy, as described in the Data Management Plan or other supporting documents as applicable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4r3pg","text":"Direct Access to Source Data/Documents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3427h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aurik","text":"The investigator/study site will cooperate and provide direct access to study documents and data, including source documentation for monitoring by the study monitor, audits by the sponsor or sponsor’s representatives, review by the Ethics Committee, and inspections by applicable regulatory authorities, as described in the Clinical Study Agreement. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0apf","text":"If contacted by an applicable regulatory authority, the investigator will notify the sponsor of contact, cooperate with the authority, provide the sponsor with copies of all documents received from the authority, and allow the sponsor to comment on any responses, as described in the Clinical Study Agreement.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ETHICAL CONSIDERATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH GOOD CLINICAL PRACTICEl
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"15ert","text":"Statement of Compliance","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pafm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgphc","text":"This study will be conducted in accordance with this protocol, the ICH GCP, 21 CFR, and applicable national and local regulatory requirements.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4du7e","text":"Before enrollment of subjects into this study, the IRB will review and approve/give favorable opinion on the protocol, ICF, any promotional material/advertisements, and any other written information to be provided to the subjects. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t1k9","text":"The IB will be provided to the IRB for review. The IRB’s composition or a statement that the IRB’s composition meets applicable regulatory criteria will be documented. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e911r","text":"If the protocol or any other information given to the subject is amended, the revised documents will be reviewed and approved/given favorable opinion by the IRB, where applicable. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"al20r","text":"The protocol amendment will only be implemented upon the sponsor’s receipt of approval and, if required, upon the sponsor’s notification of applicable regulatory authority(ies) approval.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ETHICAL CONSIDERATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH GOOD CLINICAL PRACTICEl
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b1vi4","text":"Participating Centers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2pbj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bqfp","text":"Participating clinical sites must have an appropriate IRB governance since they are actively engaged in research and provide informed consent. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2acfk","text":"The protocol and consent/assent forms will be approved for the sponsor by a central IRB review prior to release to participating sites. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52qsj","text":"Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and applicable local regulations will be followed by each participating institution in accordance with each institution’s requirements. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e26kv","text":"The participating sites will obtain approval from their corresponding review boards in accordance with their local procedures and institutional requirements.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90rrp","text":"The investigator is required to keep accurate records to ensure the conduct of the study is fully documented. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4ivi","text":"The investigational sites participating in this study will maintain the highest degree of confidentiality permitted for the clinical and research information obtained from participants participating in this study. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdbps","text":"Unless required by the laws permitting copying of records, only the coded identity associated with documents or other participant data may be copied (obscuring any personally identifying information). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85cla","text":"Authorized representatives, as noted above, are bound to maintain the strict confidentiality of medical and research information that may be linked to identify individuals. The investigational site will normally be notified in advance of auditing visits.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ETHICAL CONSIDERATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH GOOD CLINICAL PRACTICEl
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3cj9g","text":"Informed Consent/Assent","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aia3o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqrs0","text":"Written informed consent will embody the elements of informed consent as described in the Declaration of Helsinki and the ICH Guidelines for GCP and will be in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h1c0","text":"Investigators will enroll subjects according to the study eligibility criteria and in compliance with 21CFR50. The investigator will exercise no selectivity so that no bias is introduced from this source.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ETHICAL CONSIDERATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH GOOD CLINICAL PRACTICEl
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"81ra8","text":"Study Subject Confidentiality","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q95c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"u63c","text":"The investigator will comply with applicable subject privacy regulations/guidance as described as per HIPAA and any additional local regulations.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aiss9","text":"The investigational sites participating in this study will maintain the highest degree of confidentiality permitted for the clinical and research information obtained from subjects. When a subject participates in this study at more than one site, sharing of this information is required. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8vlg","text":"Sharing of information obtained during this study between clinical centers and affiliates will be done to assure subject understanding and consent, safety, and adherence to protocol. Medical and research records will be maintained at each site in the strictest confidence. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at5su","text":"However, as a part of the quality assurance and legal responsibilities of an investigation, the investigational site must permit authorized representatives of the sponsor(s) and regulatory agencies to examine (and when required by applicable law, to copy) records for the purposes of quality assurance reviews, audits and evaluation of the study safety and progress. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15jh4","text":"Unless required by the laws permitting copying of records, only the coded identity associated with documents or other participant data may be copied (obscuring any personally identifying information). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1232u","text":"Authorized representatives, as noted above, are bound to maintain the strict confidentiality of medical and research information that may be linked to identify individuals. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjenu","text":"Study records with the study subject’s information for internal use at the clinical sites will be secured at the study site during the study. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fdj7","text":"At the end of the study, all records will continue to be kept in a secure location for at least 2 years post market approval in the applicable region. There are no plans to destroy the records. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9k091","text":"Retained samples including genetic samples could be utilized to learn more about causes of type 1 diabetes, its complications (such as eye, nerve, and kidney damage) and other conditions for which individuals with diabetes are at increased risk, and how to improve treatment (e.g. via biomarker screening). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1n02g","text":"Samples can also be utilized to further evaluate those subjects responsive to therapy to elucidate treatment mechanisms. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmafs","text":"The results of these future analyses, and any mechanistic studies, will not be made known to the participant.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ETHICAL CONSIDERATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH GOOD CLINICAL PRACTICEl
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cb1qi","text":"Risks and Benefits","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58iav","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnsaa","text":"The risks of this study are presented in this protocol, the Investigator’s Brochure and the informed consent form. There is no guaranteed benefit to subjects for their participation in the study. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ETHICAL CONSIDERATIONS AND COMPLIANCE WITH GOOD CLINICAL PRACTICEl
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"743rp","text":"Ethics","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e503j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg4ba","text":"The study protocol, along with the required informed consent forms, will be approved by each participating institution’s IRB prior to the initiation of any research procedures (at the site). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c11ce","text":"In addition to details described in the sections above (informed consent, confidentiality, and risks and benefits), the investigators should review and consider ethical ramifications in the design and development of this protocol, in accordance with 21 CFR 50. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k1hr","text":"The investigators will make every effort to minimize and monitor risks and discomforts to participants throughout the course of the study.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dc8ub","text":"Monitoring","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a82ig","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4huo9","text":"Throughout the course of the study, the study monitor will make frequent contacts with the investigator. This will include telephone calls and on-site visits. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asvra","text":"The study will be routinely monitored to ensure compliance with the study protocol and the overall quality of data collected. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gc18","text":"During the on-site visits, the eCRFs will be reviewed for completeness and adherence to the protocol. As part of the data audit, source documents will be made available for review by the study monitor. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mrv3","text":"The study monitor may periodically request review of the investigator study file to assure the completeness of documentation in all respects of clinical study conduct.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnfvg","text":"The study monitor will verify that each patient has proper consent documentation from the patient and/or patient’s authorized representative for study procedures and for the release of medical records to the sponsor, FDA, other regulatory authorities, and the IRB. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65odc","text":"The study monitor will also verify that assent was obtained for patients not capable of providing informed consent or that documentation is provided by the investigator explaining why the patient was unable to provide assent. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7s2i3","text":"The investigator or appointed delegate will receive the study monitor during these on-site visits and will cooperate in providing the documents for inspection and respond to inquiries. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55d7g","text":"In addition, the investigator will permit inspection of the study files by authorized representatives of the regulatory agencies.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7prjt","text":"On completion of the study, the study monitor will arrange for a final review of the study files after which the files should be secured for the appropriate time period.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"64mgv","text":"Medical Monitor and Data Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h4o9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dksrv","text":"All adverse events will be recorded on the adverse event forms, and the treatment related SAEs will be sent to the IRB, per their reporting requirements, and to sponsor. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cq78j","text":"The study medical monitor or designee will review all adverse event reports, masked to treatment assignment. Further details are captured in the study medical monitoring plan. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4se2","text":"The DSMB is responsible for monitoring the safety of the trial subjects, and data integrity during periodic and ad hoc reviews. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1p0e","text":"Following these reviews, it can recommend to the sponsor and the study executive committee the continuation of study as planned, modification of the protocol, or the stopping of the study. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hsbt","text":"The sponsor will ensure the timely communication of the safety and efficacy data to the DSMB according to the agreed upon schedules or within reasonable time if requested for an ad hoc analysis.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gip6","text":"The DSMB will meet periodically during scheduled and ad hoc meetings as specified in its charter. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"foq41","text":"The DSMB will be provided blinded data initially. Unblinded data may be provided if requested for specific considerations. Following enrollment of approximately 18 subjects in Part 1, the 28-day follow-up data will be assessed for safety by the DSMB as pre-specified in its charter. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"324kp","text":"Enrollment in the study will be paused and will not resume until the DSMB has completed this review and communicated its recommendation to the study executive committee to continue the study as planned, continue with protocol modifications, or stop the study. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6euj4","text":"Details of the DSMB membership, frequency of the meeting, data sharing/review procedures, and voting process will be outlined in the DSMB Charter.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8fmqv","text":"Confirm that all prerequisite requirements of the test as detailed above are met prior to starting the test (i.e. participant has fasted, that fasting glucose is between 70 mg/dL and 200 mg/dL (will also be verified by in clinic by finger stick prior to testing), and that any insulin use prior to the test meets the specified guidelines).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34ojs","text":"Please refer to the Laboratory Manual for instructions on sample processing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjipv","text":"Check blood glucose level by finger stick and proceed with test if within range.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1a6n","text":"Establish IV line (after each blood draw, saline lock IV or run saline drip to keep open).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4o7a0","text":"The first sample should be taken at least 10 minutes after establishing the IV line (this is the ‘–10 minute’ sample).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9a8qc","text":"After at least 10 minutes, the second sample should be taken just before the participant drinks the Boost HP (this is the ‘0 minute’ sample). Immediately administer the Boost HP and instruct the participant to consume within 5 minutes (keep the Boost HP out of the reach of the participant so that you can control the start time). Start timer at beginning of the Boost HP drink. Patient can drink water after finishing the Boost HP and freely throughout the remainder of the test.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7sv37","text":"The remaining samples should be drawn per the collection schedule based on the start time of the Boost HP drink.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e1s1e","text":"It is critical to adhere to the collection schedule as closely as possible and to accurately record the collection times. However, it will not be considered a protocol deviation if a specimen is collected at an incorrect time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4f4mf","text":"At the conclusion of the test, check blood glucose and administer insulin as per participant’s standard insulin plan.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b1mp1","text":"Discontinue IV.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
